title: Full Body Calisthenics Routine For Beginners (Follow Along)
description:
Starting your Calisthenics journey can be VERY intimidated at the beginning, however, by choosing the right progression for the fundamental exercises you will be able to create a base and a solid foundation for more advance exercises in the future. This workout is perfect for those starting in bodyweight training! Let's begin your Calisthenics journey =)

Stay strong, stay focused.
With all love and gratitude,
Saturno Movement Team

WORKOUT:
1. Elevated push ups (8x reps)
2. Knee push ups (8x reps)
3. Negative dips (6x reps)
4. Body rows (8x reps)
5. Negative pull ups (6x reps)
6. Bodyweight squats (15x reps)
7. Elbow plank hold (30x secs)

-REPEAT 3X or 4X.
-No rest between exercises.
-Rest 2-3 minutes in between each round.

channelDescription:
Welcome to the SATURNO MOVEMENT YouTube channel! The SM Team is committed to providing the most valuable, and high-quality information about Bodyweight Training, General Fitness, and Movement Practice.

Here you can find all our FREE in-depth tutorials, follow-along practices, and training advice for Calisthenics, Yoga, Hand-Balancing, Rings, Primal Movements, Meditation, and much more!

We stand by the idea that movement not only enables us to build an outstanding physique, and improve our mental and emotional well-being, but also compels our body to perform in ways that we never thought possible.

Saturnomovement is on a mission to share the most efficient ways in detail to improve the overall mental and physical fitness level of our beloved community.

We appreciate you being here, and we look forward to connecting with you all.

With Infinite Love & Kindness,
- The SM Team

comments:
What is up guys! :) I talked a whole lot on this video (as usual XD) so to make it easier for you, here are the time stamps if you just want to fast forward to the beginning of each exercise! Happy training =)
-G

WORKOUT BEGUINS 1:42
1. Elevated push ups 2:48
2. Knee push ups 4:30
3. Negative dips 6:07
4. Body rows 9:58
5. Negative pull ups 12:07
6. Bodyweight squats 16:06
7. Elbow plank hold 18:38
I have a feeling this channel is gonna grow really fast. Amazing content !!
I am doing yoga, calistenics and movement aswell  togheter  with acrobatics. Couple  year of experience now and Still I found  your person  as a motivation. Never stop moving  my  friend!
Even if i am more advanced, I watched 'til the end just for the pleasure of seeing Gabo :)

I love your channel, Gabo! I'm an avid cyclist who has been trying to cross-train with calisthenics and proper dieting to get the weight down and lean-up! I enjoy the breakdowns of your movements, getting the proper body-position and form dialed before you move through the exercise!  Your plank is a good example! A lot of people don't push into the hollow position with a rounded back! Keep the great videos coming. I'd like to see more body-weight leg workouts and shoulder/trap progressions! Keep the great content coming!
